name: Harley Dree
text: Doug is fantastic! Amazing customer service. Clean organized shop. Even some Musical instruments to browse. 2 story shopping experience. 12 range lanes. $15 per shooter. Military discount is wonderful! Pleasant stop.

name: Benjy Abbott
text: Great place to go.  Staff was very helpful.  I brought a guy to shoot on the range that had never held a gun before in his life as he is not from America, and after filling out the paper work, we went into the range and went over proper safety for gun handling and firing and this young man had the time of his life putting Freedom Pills down range.  I’d recommend this place to anyone.  Thank You!

name: Joshua Harper
text: I did not buy anything, other than some range time. The price was fair.  I used the indoor pistol range. I enjoyed getting some group therapy. Very well maintained place. I'd recommend this place, to anyone.

name: B. Watson
text: Great range. The staff is friendly and helpful and the prices are great.

name: Patrick Battiste
text: The guy at the front counter was very helpful and curtious. It's a great place to go shoot.

name: Kendall Phillips
text: I bit pricey to shoot in the range, but very nice and very knowledgeable staff

text: Very friendly service, and a great facility to practice in!  Top notch!

name: Donald Crabbe
text: Great gun shop, well ran, very knowledgeable and professional... Had a great experience.  Bought and had some work done on some rifle parts months ago, forgot about them. They didnt sell them out from under me like most would, instead held on to them for me.  I will DEFINITELY do business again with them!!  Thanks for all you do..

resp.text: Thanks Donald for the nice comments! We look forward to seeing you next time.

name: THE WALTHERETTA
text:
Good dudes here for sure... and the best part is they work hard FOR YOU!

Quick installs and updates. Ammo is expensive everywhere, but they weren't gouging when others were. Friendly guys looking to earn your business. Very glad to finally have a gun shop in this area... and a great one at that!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words. We appreciate your business!  Look forward to serving your needs on your next visit. Thanks again!

name: Barnacle Bill
text:
I finally stopped in the other day, to check out this new store. The place is rather small! I noticed a poor selection of handguns and overly high ammo prices. I saw nothing here to make me want to return.
Don’t waste your time nor your gas here. If you follow me on Google maps... then u know where to get guns & ammo. You’d also be better off at Simmons.
👎👎

name: Rick Dykes
text: Great, locally owned Gun shop. This is the kind of place you love to hang around. Very helpful finding whatever you need, and they have a good selection of guns and even ammo (which is saying a lot right now) in stock.

resp.text: Thanks Rick!! We are glad you dropped in. We appreciate your business!

name: Addison Rush
text: Great folks who are helpful and knowledgeable.  They have a great shop with a lot of capability and they will work to get you what you want. You can purchase a gun, customize (dip) a gun or restore a gun (cerakote). We will continue doing business with these guys.

resp.text: Thanks Addison for the nice review. We appreciate your business and the opportunity to serve your gun needs. Thanks again!

name: Kyle Brown
text: Nice little gun shop. Staff was friendly and welcomed me.

resp.text: Thanks Kyle. We look forward to seeing you next time you visit with us. We appreciate your business.

name: Harry Shaver
text: Bought a gun from Austin about a year ago, haven't been to another gun store since. They have great prices and even better customer service, highly recommended!

resp.text: Thanks Harry for the kind words as it is much appreciated. We look forward to seeing you soon.

name: Steve Morgan
text: The guys at Inverness Outdoors are fantastic to work with.   I highly recommend them !!

resp.text: Thanks Steve for your nice comments. We strive to take care of each customer   with top level service and appreciation. Thanks again.

name: Steve Williams
text: I've been dealing with these guys weekly for several months. Nick & Will are awesome to do business with, are very experienced, if there's any question then call in Lonnie. The prices are fair, good selection of all types of guns, accessories are plentiful I recommend Command Tactical..

name: Kyle Brown
text: Small store shared with powersports store. Decent selection for the size. Looked at one pistol but did not buy. Prices were good and inline with other stores.

resp.text: thank you for the review, I appreciate it!

name: Aaron Rodriguez
text: Will be recommending them the everybody I know

name: samman6957
text:
Used to be a great local place to shop. Now they remind me of South Eastern Guns in trussville.

No greeting when you walk in, you can stand at the counter for 15 minutes while the employees talk amongst themselves, and IF they decide you're worthy to speak to, they are usually rude, condescending, and overall cold.

One two occasions where I went with cash in hand, ready to purchase, no one would speak to me. The first time I considered I might have caught them on a bad day. Second time, the exact same thing happend and I shrugged, and took my business to Birmingham Pistol Wholesale. (They may be packed to the gills constantly, but at least I feel welcome in BPW).

This place is alot like a restaurant that puts their best foot forward when they first open, and over time becomes a place you only go to when everything else is closed.

name: Kong Dong
text: I decided to visit Line of Fire after hearing about it from my friends. I was so impressed with the store, selection, and the prices. Jared helped me out and was so patient and accommodating. I ended up buying 2 firearms and couldn’t be happier. Thank you Jared and Line of Fire. You have a new returning customer!

name: Casper Miles
text: They're fairly priced...I use "fairly" pretty loosely. If they could lose the Rockstar attitudes it would be a pretty cool little store to go to. Business is booming for them right now, so I guess I get the restlessness of stupid questions, but come on guys...humble yourselves just a smidge.

resp.text:
Casper, when it comes to fairly priced, we truly try to be fair. It's difficult in the COVID-era because supply and demand dictate our prices. We do try and keep them as low as possible unlike many competitors in the area. That said, we're not a big box store, so there are things we can't compete with price-wise, but we'd like to think that our customer service and relationships with our loyal customers make up for that.

As far as your experience with rockstar attitudes... we will definitely address that feedback with the team. While our employees are rockstars in our eyes, we would never want any of our customers to feel put off by their attitudes. We pride ourselves on being friendly and accessible when our customers have questions or need help. We'd love for you to give us another chance in the future. Humility in check.

name: Jason Dowling
text: Always had good experiences with the folks here. If you know what you're looking for, they can pick up on that and just let you shop. If you need help they are happy to offer it. Very friendly, and competitive prices (considering the times). Great store

resp.text: Thanks Jason! We love reading good reviews like yours. Hope to see you again soon.

name: Terry Brown
text: I have purchased 4 firearms along with my mother combined and a good bit of ammo from line of fire and thought i had built a decent relationship with them and on a personal level I still feel that way about most of the people there. But i recently had my favorite pistol destroyed by their gunsmith when i took a grip to be drilled holes into and slid over a lanyard ring.  I was completely calm and understanding about it but it was my favorite pistol and its no longer complete and they did nothing to make it up to me.Then the next day I went in under an employees promise to give me a decent deal on a hi power clone that had 1 mag and no box. Needless to say I was lead in the wrong direction and i was embarrassed in front of my mother and it really hurt my feelings to be lied to. I would still shop there because I support local businesses but it wont be in the amount I used to. The one good thing i could say about them is up until recently they were fair on their pricing. But recently they have started following the online inflation pricing for certain items and their values will likely not retain that amount of money in a few months.

resp.text:
As we explained to you, the grip you chose required the removal of a press fit lanyard. We did not drill your firearm and the work was discounted for you.

To be clear, we did not lie to you. The deal you requested was not reasonable for a business to make. In the same way you are unable to haggle at the local supermarket, you can’t haggle with us. After all, there’s only but so much a small business can discount in order to remain profitable.

As far as our prices go, we do not follow the inflated internet prices like many of our local competitors do (who have much higher prices than we do), but rather we adjust our prices as our suppliers adjust theirs. It is simple supply and demand economics, and during the COVID-era it demand has gone up while access to supply has gone down. That is completely out of our control. Again, we are a business and have to make a profit to keep the doors open. Rather than price gouge, we have remained as competitive and reasonable as possible throughout this difficult time.

We’re sorry you felt embarrassed in front of your mother. We politely corrected you in how you were talking about our business, of which it’s clear you don’t understand the ins and outs. We do value you, and all of our customers, but we do feel the need to set the record straight.

name: Christian Kelly
text: Couldn’t have asked for a better experience. Great people along with a great selection of firearms.

name: Layne Loveless
text: Was willing to work with me very nice as soon as i have time ill be making another trip and over an hour away.

name: Alan Thompson
text:
Great knowledgeable staff. Have a young man
there very easy and pleasant to talk to and knows his job.

name: steve graupner
text:
If I could give 50 stars I would,  finally a gun store that knows how to treat customers and take time and answer questions and explain differences in products.  I really can’t say enough about the staff.  I’d been to 4 other shops in the Birmingham area before a friend recommended I try here, and was really getting disappointed.  I didn’t catch the guys names that assisted me unfortunately,  but he/they very patiently answered all my questions.  (I had a lot of questions about what I was buying).  I can honestly say I felt very good and well informed about my purchase when I left!
I have already,  and will be spreading the word to fellow gun owners for sure.
Keep up the great work guys!

name: Karen Hensley
text: Stopped in from Huntsville,  fantastic service, very friendly staff.  Great selection of firearms, not over priced, no wait time for help. Thanks for all your help, we will be back for sure!

resp.text: Karen, we love reading this! Glad you had a good visit. Can't wait to serve you again.

name: Eli Held
text: There ammo is way over priced go somewhere else and get a better deal They’re also kind of rude

resp.text:
Eli, we hate hearing this and are so sorry to hear that you didn't receive the customer service you deserve. We pride ourselves on being polite and attentive, even when we're busy, and we apologize for any oversight a team member may have made. We certainly hope you'll give us another chance to meet your firearm needs in the future.

As far as our prices go… they are more or less set by our suppliers. Because demand is up and supply doesn't quite match up, we're paying more for everything right now. As a business, we can't give them away for free so the price increase does get passed down to our customers. That said, we do try and make much smaller margins than many of our local small business competitors by keeping our prices lower.

name: Bare Grilles
text: Super nice and helpful staff!

name: Jeremy Thompson
text: Friendly helpful and not patronizing when you don't know the lingo

name: Eric Morrison
text: Best gun store in birmingham !area.ca

resp.text: We love hearing this Eric! Thanks for the 5-star review!

name: emma June
text: All of their ammo is overpriced and they don’t keep practice rounds in any pistol caliber they only stock hollow points in pistol calibers and they overprice those as well

resp.text:
Emma, did you ask someone for assistance? We have practice rounds for every caliber except .380 and 10mm bc those are the hardest to get still in this post-COVID world where supply does not match demand.

As far as our prices go… they are more or less set by our suppliers. Again, because demand is up and supply doesn't quite match up, we're paying more for everything right now. As a business, we can't give them away for free so the price increase does get passed down to our customers. That said, we do try and make much smaller margins than many of our local small business competitors by keeping our prices lower. We hope you'll give us another try in the future.

name: Causal Shooter
text:
2020 Update:
Staff is still very friendly. I bought about 10 guns from them now and it's always been a smooth transaction. The ammo is marked up just like everywhere else. It's because there is too much demand and not enough Supply stop crying about it. No one is wearing masks, if covid worries you that much or if you are at risk stay inside like you're supposed to. Otherwise please stop whining. You have a choice on where to spend your money if you don't feel safe doing it here then you don't have to. Trust me to do plenty of business and they aren't going to miss your transaction.

name: Garland Shorter
text: Great customer service

name: Kenneth Hayes
text: Prices are just as ridiculous as everywhere else thats why they dont post them online.

resp.text:
In reality we don't post them online because we're still in a COVID-world where supply and demand has yet to balance out and we don't keep inventory very long. Inventory doesn't sit in the store very long, so it would be a waste of time to constantly put things up and take them down off our site. We post a lot of inventory on Facebook, but don't post prices there per Facebook's firearms sales policy.

That said, our prices are more or less set by our suppliers. Again, because demand is up and supply doesn't quite match up, we're paying more for guns right now. As a business, we can't give them away for free so the price increase does get passed down to our customers, but we try and make much smaller margins than many of our local competitors.

name: Alan Thompson
text:
Great knowledgeable staff. Have a young man
there very easy and pleasant to talk to and knows his job.

name: Kyle Brown
text: Great selection of guns. Staff was nice. I called to ask about some handguns in stock and they answered right away.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review. We look forward to meeting your firearms needs for years to come.

text: Prices are just as ridiculous as everywhere else thats why they dont post them online.

name: Robert Sartain
text: A lot of folks in other shops are very judgey, and can turn away a novice like myself...but the staff at Line Of Fire made me feel very comfortable and at home. The prices and selections are very good, and I look forward to my next purchase (which I hope will be sooner rather than later).

name: Dem Guiz
text: I went to Line Of Fire for the last time Saturday.   Not one employee was wearing a mask and most customers weren't. I'm over 60 and have asthma.  I can't take unnecessary chances with this pandemic and I don't understand the mentality of people who seem to feel that their discomfort from wearing a mask is more important than public health.  I won't be coming back.

name: Isopherus
text: Super friendly employees and a great selection of firearms. I will definitely be returning. There were several guns I was interetested in purchasing soon. It is quite a drive for me but worth it for the selection this business offers. Definitely a good stop

name: Jason Sarazin
text: Line of fire is a great place to buy used or new. I bought a used rifle and didn't quite understand the safety on it until after I bought it and GABE showed me how it worked. I was thinking I might have to return it. They are very friendly and helpful. I've stopped by several times and he's helped me every time. GABE IS AWESOME! I will definitely be back to buy from him again soon. Thanks alot!

name: James Lawley
text: I was helped at the counter immediately when I entered the store and received the highest level of customer service. I'll be spending alot more money with you in the future. Why did you have to be so helpful!

resp.text: Woohoo! We love this James. Glad to have your business.

name: Eric Morrison
text: Best gun store in birmingham !area.ca

resp.text: We love hearing this Eric! Thanks for the 5-star review!

name: Wayne Knight
text: Their staff is welcoming and helpful. Not a high pressure sales environment. They have a great selection of Firearms and accessories.

name: Robert Sartain
text: A lot of folks in other shops are very judgey, and can turn away a novice like myself...but the staff at Line Of Fire made me feel very comfortable and at home. The prices and selections are very good, and I look forward to my next purchase (which I hope will be sooner rather than later).

name: Paul Allen
text: Nice staff and a great selection

resp.text: Thanks Paul, we're here to meet your firearms needs.

name: Wayne Knight
text: Their staff is welcoming and helpful. Not a high pressure sales environment. They have a great selection of Firearms and accessories.

name: Shaun Curtis
text: Very great business... Crab establishment... Great conversations are held here... Very friendly staff... Knowledgeable and courteous... 5 stars all around!!

name: Nick Oldham
text: Traded in two guns also bought one. Had a great experience all the times I have been. The employees are hilarious and always seem to be having a good time.

name: David Thompson
text: Great shop with knowledgeable staff. Firearm Transfer fee is a little high at $30 but they make up for it with a great shop.

name: Shaw Gaines
text: Good selection. Friendly service. Fair price on something I'd been trying to find for some time.

name: Isopherus
text: Super friendly employees and a great selection of firearms. I will definitely be returning. There were several guns I was interetested in purchasing soon. It is quite a drive for me but worth it for the selection this business offers. Definitely a good stop

name: Christopher Silvey
text: Great place and great staff!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Christopher. We certainly appreciate the kind words and your business.

name: Jessica Morgan
text: I had a very good experience today. Everybody was friendly and very helpful. I will definitely be going back for more Purchases!

name: Brian Hammonds
text: Best guys in Alabama. They know

name: Jason Sarazin
text: Line of fire is a great place to buy used or new. I bought a used rifle and didn't quite understand the safety on it until after I bought it and GABE showed me how it worked. I was thinking I might have to return it. They are very friendly and helpful. I've stopped by several times and he's helped me every time. GABE IS AWESOME! I will definitely be back to buy from him again soon. Thanks alot!

name: Matthew Miller
text: Found 2 pistols at a very reasonable price. Staff was great and store is beautiful. Will be returning for any future purchases.

name: Waylon Lander
text: Awesome

name: George Tice
text: Helpful Nice good variety of weapons

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star rating, George.

name: Larry Robinson
text: Very good shop to visit, very clean store, knowledgeable and friendly staff. Prices compare to big box stores. Will continue to shop for supplies and ammo there. Go visit if your in the market to upgrade or first timer.

name: Jon Snow
text: I will never go in this place again , i stood at the counter for 15 min. While 3 employees were gossiping at office door while one employee waited on customers.

name: Michael Koratich (BioGuy)
text: Traded one and bought two.  Honest, knowledgeable, helpful.  Ruger prices as good or better than anywhere around.

name: Virginia A
text: Great selection and prices, comparable to larger stores, selection's really broad too ranging from budget friendly to quite higher end. Lots of accessories and holsters, from locally made leatherwork and kydex etc. Awesome staff who are super knowledgeable and fun to talk to!

name: Francisco Negron
text: Good selection friendly people and positive environment

name: DougInAlabama
text: Very courteous staff, I will definitely be a returning customer.

name: Daffy Dill
text: Nice store and friendly sales people but prices seem to be rising. $330 for a Taurus TX while exile guns have them for $249.00....

name: Mark Barber
text: I went to find a tactical light for my shotgun. They had tons of options. I showed the man helping me, a cheap light mount I had bought online. After showing me their options, (which were all very reasonably priced) the man told me he'd be happy to get me set up with something, but I could save myself some money if I wanted too, by using the mount I already had and a certain Mini Mag flashlight that could be purchased at Wal-Mart.... This man could have told me anything, and sold me anything, because I wasn't very knowledgeable about what I needed to buy. Instead of just taking the easy sell, the man treated me like one of his ol friends, that he was trying to help out. I left without buying anything that day, but from now on, when I need anything having to do with guns, I will definitely be using "Line of Fire" in Moody. With the way the world is these days, on the rare occasion that you find a business like this one, everyone should do as much as possible to support them. Just maybe they'll raise the bar for the next guy.

name: Bobby Pierson
text: Went in line of fire saturday got a good trade value on my gun ended up getting smith& wesson one of the best hand guns ive owned wasent rushed and they answered any questions i had will deffentley be going back thatnks line of fire staff

name: Rigid hyperion78
text: Great staff, good environment and local business

name: Mike Murray
text: Great staff, very knowledgeable, best prices in the Birmingham area. I'll be back for my next purchase.

name: Knew Atkmaj
text: Very friendly and good prices.

name: Mandy Collier
text: Knowledgeable & Friendly Staff!

name: Tammy Maxwell
text: Bought one going right back to purchase another one

name: Richard Kelly
text: Great place and people

name: Ethan Jeff
text: Straight savage

name: Jason Clark
text:
Awesome place! Great selection! and the guys there know firearms in and out. They're very knowledgeable and know their stuff! The atmosphere there is very chill also. They didn't try to push me into buying something that i didn't even want. They make their suggestion when you tell them what you are looking for and they just kind of step back and let you make your own decision about it.

I appreciate that! I Can't stand to be pressured about buying something.
Top notch business and Top notch people there!
I'll be back👍

name: Rob Jordan
text: Today was my first time going in here, and the guys really helped me out I gave them what I wanted and price range and they made it happen. They are very knowledgeable guys and know everything it is when it comes to guns. The guys in there are easy to talk to and truly want to help you. Highly recommend.

name: Anthony Thomas
text:
Great shop, stopped in this week for the first time after my local shops all disappointed me with bad customer service.

Drove 40 minutes to get here. Staff was great, had a great selection, purchased me a new pistol chambered carbine for a great price.

resp.text: Thank you Anthony, We take pride in our customer service, and by the way we stand by our guns. We hope to have a big shipment of ammo next week. Safe shooting. Don

name: Alex Medlin
text: High prices and poor customer service

name: Mr. K
text: Really enjoyed the salesman I worked with. I knew exactly what I wanted however he showed me a more recent model that I had no idea about. His recommendation was more ideal for the purpose of my purchas . Every concern I had, he showed me a viable solution.  Thanks for the professionalism and knowledge.

name: Bobby Kilgore
text: Great store!  Anything and everything you could ever want for shooting.  People are great and know what they are doing!  Highly recommend this store.  You won't be disappointed.

resp.text: We try to please. It's all about customer service.

name: Joshua Mitchell
text: Very knowledgeable and helpful guys. At first look it may seem they don't have as many guns as a place like Academy but they actually have way cooler and more quality stuff. Plus they actually know their guns. Tom helped me find a perfect concealed carry weapon as I wasn't very familiar with the different types of handguns. They have a lot of cool surplus gear too. They are a very experienced crew who can also make a new customer feel comfortable so I would recommend this shop to new shooters or professional ones the same.

name: Herman Daniel
text: They have almost anything that you can find online but you are standing there talking to a real person. They are awesome and the only thing that I am sorry for is the fact that I had not found them sooner. Found my go to  tactical shop. Glad I found yall!!

resp.text: Thanks for finding us. We try hard to give great customer service. Thank for your business.

name: agbond003
text:
Overall, my experience at Southern Survival Store has been absolutely positive.
The Products they carry are of great quality and prices are more then reasonable. The customer service is top notch and I always feel welcome to approach them. When I ask a question or ask for an opinion on certain items, the staff will answer in a fashion that illustrates both honesty and integrity. When you have an interest in a particular item, the staff will not give you a few sale's pitch lines; instead they will tell you their actuall experience with the product. Knowing that these guys really use what they sale brings confidence in my purchases. Long story short, this is the best example of an army surplus store in every category that can be graded.
I highly encourage anyone one with outdoors, survival, or defense needs to check this place out.

name: Brian Mccall
text:
I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door, really nice staff. I was under the impression I was walking into a oldschool millitary surplus somthing like heart of dixie was so i must say i left a little disapointed but i will be back for hunting ammo for m1
I notice it was almost half price of what i paid last time

resp.text: Brian, thanks for coming into our store. We used to have lots of surplus but as you saw we are selling out of that business. We now focus on Tactical Guns and Training. Thank you for your review. Don

name: Leon Stark
text: They don't treat you like an idiot for asking what something is or about firearms. That alone makes them better than most places I decided not to do business with. Very good selection of products.

name: Nguyen Huy

text:
I just stopped in today knowing exactly what I wanted. I bought a whole bunch of ammo. This store may be small but don’t let the size fool you. They keep the shelves stocked and selection vast!
Upon entering you’re overcome by this cabin outdoorsy feeing of assorted taxidermy and a plethora of wall to wall long guns, stocked handguns & knives, not to mention everything else you wish u had.
This is my second time in the store and every visit, I’m greeted upon entering. It’s a nice feeling knowing you’re welcome. Michael... helped me with finding the right ammo & checked out my purchase. Other employees also seemed very attentive asking if I needed help and assisting other customers.
They have it all here and keep me returning when headed north. Stop on in, you won’t regret it. 👍👍😁🇺🇸

name: C J
text: Went in today to look at their knife selection. They definitely have the biggest selection of knives around this area. Their Florence store (called St. Nicks Knives) also has a really good selection. I was helped by Noah. He was extremely kind and helpful. He knew his blade steels, didn't make me feel rushed, was really glad to show me anything I wanted to see and had a great retail personality. I've worked in retail management all my adult career. The personality of the salesman, and their willingness to show me products without making me feel like a hinderance are the two things I really look for in a retail store. This store delivered. I also spoke with two other employees briefly (an older gentleman with a fantastic beard and a younger girl). Both of them were kind and attentive. Their prices are a little high compared to online prices (specifically BladeHQ) but they DO price match, and they don't make a big deal out of doing it like some stores in Florence/Huntsville do. Overall this seems like a fantastic store and I will be back once I've decided on which model knife I want to buy. When you are able to make the customer WANT to buy from your store instead of ordering online then you've done your job as a retail associate. These guy definitely did it. My only suggestion would be to try and pick up a bit larger selection of Microtechs. Although I know these are often hard to find in stock, and I don't know how well they sell in Athens Alabama. Thanks for the great service Winter Timber!

resp.text: Thanks for your review CJ! We are always working to expand our Microtech selection but they tend to be relatively hard to get unfortunately. We are glad Noah was able to help you out!

text: I have purchased from here many times. I recently Purchased a rifle from here, and was getting my new scope mounted. They screwed me over as they said "The mounting and boresighting is on the house for I enjoy seeing young people buying guns" I took it a nice gesture, but I soon realised that's not what happened at all. I am infuriated that they were so inconsiderate of my belongings Vortex says that since it is only cosmetic that the warranty dosent apply, I'm disappointed Joe I thought you had respect!

Since 1971 we have offered the same service free to any and all customers who purchase a rifle. If you have an issue then it’s because you haven’t talked to the staff about it ! I assure they will find the answer!  Thanks Guys for always, always, always  going above and beyond . We need more businesses with this type of service and commitment in the community  !  Thanks and God Bless !  See you soon.
Brad Shaneyfelt and Family

I can see the tradition continuing for years. She will likely out shoot you before you know it..lol. Bless you and yours,...Jeff , Joe and Bob

name: Steve Tubbs
text: Been to the Goldmine Pawn many times over the years and always had a pleasant experience and bought a good bit of merchandise even tho many things could have been purchased cheaper elsewhere. I traded at Goldmine Pawn because Tom the owner and his employees have been friendly and knowledgeable. However today’s experience was far under par. I was attempting to transfer ownership of a gun my friend no longer wanted, during the process my friend tried to get clarification on a question being asked on the questionnaire from  an employee. Another employee mistakenly thought he was asking me and very rudely started a dissertation on how we couldn’t be discussing the forms. I explained we weren’t that he was only asking for clarification. Instead of stopping or apologizing she kept on becoming even more forceful. I asked her to please be more pleasant when she expressed herself. At this the young gentleman waiting on us went off and said they were married and tore up everything. To let a misunderstanding get that far out of hand was unfortunate and immature. The owners were obviously not present. So sorry to lose one of my favorite places!

resp.text:
Mr Tubbs,

If there were any way to publish security footage on here, we would. When the owner returned to the store, he was made aware of the situation and shredded the paper himself, I did not tear up anything. During the process of assisting you and your friend, we agreed to do extra paperwork just to give you the customer service you are accustomed to here, and during that process you were instructed numerous times to direct your questions to an employee, not your friend. When a young female employee became more insistent you and your friend following these federal guidelines, you began to berate that employee on her method of instruction. Had it been left at that, we would have continued to help you. However, you continued by throwing your pen on the counter only to continue your harassment of our employee moments later. At that point we politely refunded your money and repeatedly told you to have a good day. Considering you even offered to apologize to our employee, you obviously knew you were in the wrong in some way, shape, or form. We are not in the business of turning people away, and we do hate that we lost a customer. But, our employees deserve the same respect you do. Again, we hope you have a good day.

name: Big Buck
text: I have spend lots of money here but will never spend a dime there again. The women there are extremely rude and think they know far more than they do . I will be happy to pay the high prices of Bass Pro shop and be treated  better there. For Gods sake go somewhere else and be treated like a valuable customer.  These people have a God complex

resp.text: Our 39 year old business would not be around today if we treated our customers like you describe. We do not have a "god complex", however we do know what is right and what is wrong.  Without more context it would be hard to go deeper into what happened, but I can assure you we have more knowledge that most places around, especially the big box stores you mentioned. Have a great day!

They offer more parts, pieces and paraphernalia than most actual 'rifle stores' Ive been to. Possibly any rifle store. Calling them a pawn shop is an understatement.

text: Love coming here and seeing the wide selection of firearms. Being a glock blue label dealer is always a plus.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, we strive for excellence and variety of products.

name: Jeff Alfred
text: It took forever for my brother to leave with his firearm. In all I spent close to an hour as my brother tried to purchase his firearm. The young boy with black hair behind the counter did not seem to know what he was doing and had to keep getting assistance. Not to mention, he lacked basic firearm knowledge when I spoke with him. The man with reddish hair was perhaps the most helpful and I wish we got him when visiting. Also, I’ve never seen a place photograph a person buying a firearm. Seems like a subtle violation of the 2A if you ask me. I’ve done tons of firearm purchases and never have I spent this long in a store nor have I every been photographed. If things change with my future visits I will adjust my rating but if not I doubt I will purchase from here again.

resp.text:
Jeff,

We will address you review point by point:

We are sorry that your visit took longer than expected- you may not be aware of the increase in traffic since COVID 19 started. Gun stores have been very overwhelmed, as well as the NICS background check system. Even to this day when things have slowed down, checks are still taking up to 30 minutes in some cases. This leads us to our second point-to try and decrease these wait times, we have new employees, one of which was helping you. You cannot be upset with how long a transaction is taking (part of which is out of our control) while simultaneously complaining about our efforts to train new people. Lastly, are you aware that nearly all gun stores have security cameras? Is that still an infringement on your rights? We also have a copy of your ID when buying a gun. Taking a picture of our customers (not just gun customers) for our internal system has been our policy for years with no complaints. I would suggest buying from individuals from now on if you're truly that concerned with your face being seen while buying a gun. Have a great day! -the man with the reddish hair

name: Leeann hyer
text: At least one of the female employees needs to be trained to know the difference between fine and fake diamonds. I needed to borrow enough to pay a bill this past Monday and the lady that waited on me informed me that my 1.25 Carat miner's cut diamond ring wasn't real and suggested that maybe I should go sell it to the jeweler that told me that it was ha! I left there very annoyed and went to the competitor down the road and was offered $1000 by the owner as soon as I walked through the door if I was interested in selling it. He looked at it for about 10 seconds and knew the value. I was still not interested in selling but I did borrow exactly what I needed and thanked him for his knowledge and interest. I'm not one to complain but she really made me mad. I left there feeling insulted. No customer should ever leave a business feeling that way. How can I walk into one shop and they not even offer the value of the gold in a ring and the other shop offer me $1000 cash if I would sell? Crazy..

resp.text:
Leeann,

We are sorry for the experience you had while trying to make a pawn. There must have been some kind of misunderstanding, so we do hope you can give us another chance someday soon.

name: Bailey Hart
text: jennifer the manager here is very rude and not helpful kicked me out of the range for being “disrespectful” after she piped in on a personal conversation very inappropriate and unprofessional will never return

resp.text:
Sorry Bailey.  You weren’t even with the two men that came in. You are the girlfriend of Mathew Crider.  We don’t allow cursing and disrespectful behavior in our range, and they never even made it down to the range. This was our response to your boyfriend.

“ The first question on our entry form for our GUN range is “Are you under any emotional distress?”. By the cursing at your family member in the store, we made the decision that you obviously WERE under some kind of emotional distress, and we did not want to see a repeat of that on the range with a deadly weapon. Jena made the correct move by not allowing you on our range, as a hothead with a gun is never a good idea. Not only are we concerned with YOUR safety, but for the safety of our other customers as well, including the family member you were with. We take safety very seriously here and we are not sorry that you were offended by that. Maybe next time you go to a gun range, curse out your family member BEFORE you show up, as to not make your anger issues so obvious. Have a great day! ”

name: Nick Bounds
text:
Poorly trained employees. The girl who assessed my AR didn't even know what an upper and lower receiver was. If you're going to buy and sell guns at least take the time to educate your employees.

Edit as per response from owner: Nobody is talking about how you don't buy built rifles, I sure am tickled that you remember me but I'm simply stating your employee didn't know basic gun terminology. But you should know, you were "standing there". Great response though, looks really good and professional that you accuse patrons of lying. Just accept that you're outclassed by other pawn shops in the area in both customer service and employee training.

resp.text: Anyone who has visited our store, knows that statement is incorrect. We SELL them daily. I was standing there. I’m sorry our insurance company won’t allow us to take mismatched Frankenstein firearms, but don’t take it out on us, by leaving a poor, untrue review.  5 stars on our Facebook page. When knocking on door I was told by the staff that they close at 12:00 on Saturday.  It was 12:02.  To come back when they are open. Apparently they are only open 10:30 to 12:00 on Saturdays. Google says open Saturday’s till 5, you would assume they would be open. But apparently they will lock the door in your face. Not the kind of place I want to spend my money at.

name: Rebecca Spivey
text: I wanted to rent a truck or trailer from a different U-Haul location on Saturday, but that place was closed, so U-Haul called to tell me to go Depot Pawn. I said I didn't want to rent from them and canceled the order, but time was running out to get anything from another place, so I ended up going there anyway, despite my better judgment telling me to delay until another day. Andy was nice when I picked up the trailer, and I told the woman there – his wife, I think – that I didn't want the insurance because American Express would cover it. They charged me for insurance anyway. I had to keep the trailer two extra days because I had trouble with my truck, and when I called to tell Andy I was bringing it back, he gave me the total. I said it was wrong, but they wouldn't fix it. I called U-Haul and was told they would call Depot to straighten it out, but he still overcharged me and was rude about it. I told him I'd told the woman I didn't want the insurance, but he refused to take it off and said it was between me and U-Haul, after the U-Haul rep already confirmed to me that I was being overcharged. Then he acted like he was doing me a favor by taking one day's rental off because I was a little late bringing it back today. I said that was because I was on the phone with U-Haul disputing the charge, but he still acted like he was being nice. Not nice at all. I don't appreciate being conned and then treated rudely. This is why I didn't want to go to Depot in the first place. I don't like dealing with pawn shops and don't want to give them my money. I'll never rent anything at Depot Gun & Pawn again, and I sure won't ever go there to buy anything.

name: Robert Jackson
text: The young fellow that runs the music side of the shop is honest and not shy to give you a fair deal, and admit when something is not his area of expertise.  Definitely recommend for strings and amps, whether buying or trading.  Rare to see someone in that line of work make fair offers... most pawn(like) shops lowball the crap out of you.  Andy (on the pawn side) is a good guy too but don't expect to get paid what you ask for, though of course that's his job.  Good selection of everything too, from tools to electronics to guns to jewelry, and not ridiculously marked up.  Just negotiate!

The entire staff spoke to me and my kids who I let tag along. The staff brought out new inventory as well as firearms on  consignment. I was shown a Panzer bull pup 12 gauge shotgun and I was so impressed with the establishment and the staff I left the store to ask my wife's (permission of course) to buy the Panzer because i did not bring my cellphone. After explaining what happened she agreed to allow me to purchase it. The staff as well as the owner once again stayed late and waited for me to return so I could  buy it. If that's not going above and beyond for their customers I don't know what is. Business in our area could learn a lot from these people. Thank you for helping keep our city safe and for your superior service. God Bless the U.S. of A. and Ready Arm Defend. 🇺🇲

name: Robin Boydstun
text:
Today 7/16/2021 we went into money miser pawn to buy an air conditioner and they had 2. We purchased the more expensive of the 2 got it home 15 minutes later to find out that it didn't blow cold or have the remote control that goes to it so we called and ask if they had the remote that we couldn't change the temp and that it blows hot. The employee after putting us on hold for awhiles aid they don't refund for merchandise but they would give us $10 to go buy a remote for it. We paid $138 to them for an air conditioner that doesn't work. I must say I am very sad that I got ripped off.
I don't recommend them at all

resp.text: Hello My name is Ken Barnes, I am the General Manager here at Money Mizer. When you called  you spoke to one of my employees that works here and asked if we had the remote. We did not have the remote. You stated that you needed the remote to change some settings on it and that you could not get it cold enough without the remote. My employee made me aware of what went on and that you were asking for a remote control that we did not have, we did place you on a brief hold so we could find the remote locally for you and offered to refund the cost of the remote as you stated you just needed the remote to change the settings. We tracked one down here locally we told you exactly where it was and the price for it and offered to refund that part of the sale to cover the cost of the remote. I am sorry if you feel like this is bad customer service if you would like to come in and see me I would be happy to speak with you about this situation.

name: Calvin McDaniel
text: Me and my brother come in here fir a hand gun and were really impressed with the level of service that they provided my brother. He’s a happy camper, and I told him I’d share his experience!

resp.text: Glad to hear you had a great experience here!! If there is anything else we can help with please just let us know or drop into the store, we would be happy to help!!

I was able to find my baby "glock 43" an soon me and my husband will go to the gun range Thank You so Much

name: Candy Lady
text: So as many of you know service had to be extremely good or extremely bad for me to leave a survey. In this case service was extremely good. The only reason its 4 and not 5 stars is because the clip I wanted wasnt in stock. Although Thomas insisted on ordering it. Fran and Thomas took care of me. This was the first time I went to this pawn shop after calling around Thomas was the only one that was polite on the phone and welcomed me and my husband when we went there. OMG, Fran was the best its nice to see a woman knowledgeable in ammunition. This is truly a team of experts Thomas was really amazing when to came to discussing products and services and extremely patient when I was changing my mind back and forth on my firearm. I could continue to write but its best you get the experience yourself. I live in Georgia by the way was passing through; however, I will be going back!!!!! Keep up the good work. Oh yea and I saw ALOT of regulars... So what that tell you??

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!! If we can help you with anything else do not hesitate to give us a call. We can ship items to you as well if you can not make the trip over.

text: The older gentleman I assume he was the owner or manager provided the best experience I've had at a gun store I've been coming here since 2015 when I bought my first AR. The prices are competitive and when trading in a gun or selling they offer the best prices around. Was offered 300$ in store credit on a handgun while 200 was the average I was offered (had a offer from tuckers in priceville for 100$, 200$ lower than Bama)  biggest thing for me is that I've never been disrespected or talked too in a negative or condescending way when I'm there I'm not a firearm expert but that doesn't mean I'm stupid or don't know anything.

name: L3ML
text: This shop is great! They always have tons of tools in stock. Every time I go in to sell some jewelry, they are very honest about what I have, and if I don't know what I have they are very good at figuring out what I have. They are just honest and up front about pawning, selling, and buying. I've never had a bad experience.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback!  We do our best!  Come back and see us!

name: Ed Colton
text: I see some of the bad reviews but disagree for the most part. My son and I know guns, know prices, and know calibers and can make our own informed choices. We like being left to our own devices to peruse the inventory and ask to see a weapon if we have interest. The guys always are ready to help if we need them. What else can we ask. Plus we liked the fact they had their Boxer dog laying around.  She was a good old gal and will be missed.

resp.text: Thanks Ed, we sincerely appreciate your opinion!  Honest, straight forward, and like a boss!  Appreciate you coming in!

name: Jake Livingston
text:
Rip off!!!! Was charged $120 for a USED tool bag and 5 USED hand tools. $60 for a used tool bag I later found out I could have got brand new from Home Depot for $59. Was charged and additional $60 for 5 USED NON-NAME Brand hand pliers for a total of $120.
This place is a joke a scam and a rip off, save your money go else where not only will you get better service you will get better quality and fair pricing.

resp.text: I am sorry you feel you were not treated fairly, but if you were unhappy with the price of the items that you knew were used you could have placed the items back on the shelf an not purchased them. This is a pawn shop so it should not be a surprise that most all the items for sale are used items. We check prices daily to make sure we are 30 to 50% below fair market value. Name brand items are priced accordingly.

name: Tammy Balentine
text: Absolutely the rudest pawn shop I've ever felt with! Private messages me when I gave them a Facebook review not about product but only to be rude and complain about their review! I messaged their business around 10am on sat they didn't respond till the next day being terrible towards me and my opinions,  the other businesses I messaged about my husband's new gun responded right away or at least by the end of the day.

resp.text: Rude customer, she did not appreciate us trying to honestly work through the situation of her review.  She left a review upon false information, there were never any questions that could have been answered about the "product" in the time frame she "offered."  The sad part is she could have made a short, simple phone call to avoid her situation.  Rash and ill tempered she would only see it her way. Short sidedness, a lack of understanding, and poor communication on her part lead to this review.  Her opinion is the only one that matters to her, and we cannot please someone out looking for problems.   We fulfilled our end of what we advertised.  We are thankful for our customers, their respect of our business practices, and common sense!

name: Cedric Banks
text:
Wanted to spend good money but no was interested in helping me, visited 3 times to give them a chance not to leave me with a bad impression but it was painfully clear I was not welcome, not trying to play the race card but I did not feel welcome and there was no indication of concern to help me.
Thanks for giving me the opportunity to shop else where.

resp.text: I'm sorry you feel this way Mr. Banks.  Did you ask for help?  I would like to address the situation with any employee that would refuse to help an interested customer, buying or not.  We pride ourselves in giving the best customer service we can.  If you'd like to come back in and ask for Grant, I will personally help you myself.  There are no race cards to be played up here as well Mr. Banks.  We do not interpret race that way.  Everyone is a customer, no matter the race, no matter the clothes, everyone matters.  We've been here over 25 years for a reason.

name: Bob Gohn
text: Fantastic place! You never know what you might find at Bama Pawn. The folks there are very friendly and helpful with all of your needs

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback!  We do our best!  Come back and see us!

name: Trevor Bright
text: I have been in the store multiple times and on every occasion I haven't had one employee greet me or ask of I needed help. I had great intentions of buying something but it seemed that they figured since I'm a young I'm not going to spend alot of money so there is no point in helping him...

resp.text: We're sorry for any experiences you've had where you were not greeted or helped in our store. We actually pride ourselves on our customer service and tell all of our employees to greet customers when they come and go. I'm not making an excuse but at times we do get busy either helping other customers or keeping up with all the paperwork that comes through the store so we may miss a customer here and there. But if you've been in multiple times we should have helped you. As far as judging you by your age or if you're going to spend a lot of money... we have a huge range of prices on tools, guns, and accessories. So whether you're going to spend money or not we aren't going to discriminate against you based off your age, race, gender, or even the size of your wallet. Again, we apologize that you had such bad experiences in our store but we appreciate you bringing it to our attention. Hopefully you'll come back and give us the chance to treat you differently.

name: LG Knives
text: Bama Pawn and gun is a great place to go...I use them as my FFL and they have ALWAYS been helpful, VERY attentive, even answering calls to check on arrivals of merchandise.  I will continue to do business with them as they are just good people...They are a busy store, but so worth the wait in their customer service.

resp.text: We appreciate you and your business!  Thanks so much for the great review!  Keep on coming back!!

name: Sea Dragon
text: Prices are a little high but selection is awesome!

resp.text: We appreciate the positive feedback, ask about our price matching next time you're in the market to buy a gun locally!  Come back and see us!

name: Randy Tucker
text: They try to get rich off every sale. No customer service. Rude. Goto Tucker Pawn priceville for a great deal. I saved 119.00 on one purchase and Tuckers are great people. No relation to me but great people.

resp.text:
If this customer has been in our store, he or she has never addressed any issues with us or asked us to price match, I've never had any issues price matching Tuckers pricing, ever.  We typically compete with other stores in our radius just fine.  Academy Sport is right down the road as well.  We often get phone calls of them having to price match us.  Also, I find it odd the customer has the same last name whether they "claim" no relation or not and praise tuckers all in the same review.  Never the less, all of our other reviews speak for themselves.  It's a shame someone sink this low to jeopardize our ratings.  I hope this review speaks multitudes for the type of person this is.

Just a comparison for all you googler's out there, check out our pricing vs their pricing on Davidson's Gallery of Guns, it just proves this was a low blow and we are cheaper.

name: Bear Man Mountaineering
text: Excellent guys to do business with!  Great weapons at even greater prices!

resp.text: We appreciate your business and the great review!  Thanks so much and keep on coming back!!

name: SSGT Scott
text: Open @830 on saturdays. Well 0836 and no one is here to open the store for me to get my property that has already been paid for.

resp.text: We are a mom and pop store, family emergency's can't be helped.  Nor were you in the parking lot at 8:40 AM when I arrived.  We went above and beyond to remedy your situation and we cannot help your attempt to pickup your merchandise at the last minute and late might I add. We did not have to do what we did.  Nor any of the help we've ever given to you and your family.  I do apologize for running late.  We do however appreciate the review and know where we stand after years of business based on one instance, and not all the other smooth transactions we have shared together.  I do not understand the rash decision to sacrifice a relationship over a temper tantrum, a personal mistake, and 10 minutes. - Grant C, Management

He also sold me the cheaper arrow stop explaining that it was kind of unnecessary to buy the more costly one, his experienced not only saved me money, but also allowed me to perfectly drop a buck with a heart shot at 58yards with my crossbow (Ravin r20). name: Christopher Walker
text: Good selection, I’m glad they even had shotgun shells, but $15 a box for 12 gauge target shells seems like a pretty steep markup considering they’re about $9 a box most other places.

resp.text: Mr Walker, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review.  I'd like to ask you to reconsider after I explain the prices. This past year has been really difficult to find ammo because of Covid and extreme demand. We can not buy it through our normal wholesale routes so we are literally just buying it from whoever we can find it with online. So, we are paying markup-ed prices plus tax, plus shipping that we do not normally have to pay. We personally made a decision to only mark up ammo at the most $3. A lot of what we have, we only mark up $1 to try to keep the price down. We aren't making much money but at least we have product on the shelves where the other local stores and pawn shops do not.  It's only been very recently where the big box stores have started to get some ammo in. Unfortunately, the small mom and pops like us still haven't been offered any inventory. This is why the prices are unusually high. Under normal circumstances, we have the best prices around.

text: This place is professional and organized, the staff is nice and have a large amount of team members to handle a full house. This is where my business will belong. name: Pew Pew Review
text: Justin, Tara, and whole crew were completely awesome!  I showed up a few minutes before closing time to purchase a pistol and they stayed late waiting on the background check to clear.  In the meantime, they put up with my constant bartering and badgering, lol.  They were very easy to work with and have one of the best selections of firearms in stock during a time when most shops have very slim pickings. Thanks for the SIG mat Justin!!!!

name: Sam Busbin
text: Redstone pawn has an all around amazing staff and they are genuinely a pleasure to deal with, like any pawn shop you may be low balled at times, but at least these guys are polite and respectful about it, and are usually receptive to negotiations unlike every other pawn shop in the Huntsville area, where it's a take it or leave it attitude. They also have an exceptional selection of brand new handguns and some selection of long guns and also a good selection of used firearms with usually very reasonable prices outside of a pandemic economic environment for firearms. All around my favorite pawn shop, I don't go anywhere else anymore. They even send you text reminders on your phone when your loans come up for renewal about 3-5 days ahead of time. All in all, I've had numerous great experiences here, and I constantly recommend them to everyone who asks.

text: Great store with lots of high quality items. I’ve been in a few times and I will tell you that you’re not going to find any Harbor Freight junk in here. In my experience most pawn shop employees are quite rude but everyone I’ve dealt with here was very polite with me. And they don’t low ball you when buying things either you will get a fair deal. I have an iPad mini 2 that isn’t in great condition, has a cracked screen, and they have pawned it for me twice for 40$.

name: Misti Daniel
text: If I could leave no stars I would, I used to think redstone pawn was a fair and just business. In the past I've been helped alot by wes and others who work there,  but the way I was treated last month was unfair, shady and down right wrong. A couple of months back I bought a 9mm Taurus hand pistol we did all the proper paperwork and I was approved. In may I got in a bind and went to redstone pawn as I have in the past and got a loan on my gun. When I came back to pick it up  wes made me take another background check and said that I was delayed and to come back in a cpl of days. First off I should have not had to go threw that process again the gun was already mine and I have a receipt of proof of ownership, I was just paying back my loan and picking up my property. When he contacted me back a couple of days later he didn't call he texted me and said i was denied and kept my gun that I have receipt of ownership for nor did he give the full value of the gun he gave me the loan money back mind you I have an expired gun permit. This was a scam to cheat a customer out of money and his property and i want stand for it, I'll be taken more legal action against this business and show them that you can't treat people like this. I was a good customer to them and they handled me very rough and not fair at all, businesses like this get over because as consumers we dont know the law in Alabama you only have to a permit to carry a firearm not to own one. They violated my second amendment right also no way I failed a background check I work for DHR and I passed the first one I took for the gun nothing has changed so why did I fail this time. Because I didn't fail and I've bought guns from Larry's pistol and pawn which is were  I should have stayed I would advise all consumers not to deal with these crooks, know the power of your dollar and

resp.text: Mr. Daniel this review is completely unwarranted.  We are a Federal Firearms Licensed Dealer.  We are regulated by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms(ATF) and comply with all federal and state laws.  All individuals who are purchasing or redeeming a firearm have to pass a federal background check.  We run all federal background checks through the FBI NICS(National Instant Criminal Background Check System).  If an individual is denied through the government background check we can not release a firearm to them.  We tried to explain the situation to you in the store and give you the proper information to appeal the decision of the federal background check but you were too frustrated for us to help you through that process.  This is a situation out of our control.  We are more than happy to assist with your appeal.  If you are able to rectify the situation with the FBI/ATF we would work with you to get you back the firearm for the price to redeem the original loan amount.  If you are unable to appeal the background check we would be happy to pay you the difference in the value of the gun minus what was owed to payoff the original loan.  We appreciate each customer and their business, we are not interested in taking advantage of anyone.

name: Carlos M. Fernandez
text:
UPDATE 6-11-21 This business is truly worthy of a ten (10) Star rating! Once again they have come through in a professional, technically competent, and competitively priced manner. I had the barrel of my 20 gauge shotgun cut down to the regulatory length for home defense (18.5") and it came out perfect. The weapon looks like it just came out of the box! Truly a professional and talented job by the resident gun smith's! Thank you to all. Your results may vary.

BREAK

Should be in the 10+ Star club! I was extremely impressed with my first interaction with your staff. Erin (Counter Lady) and Gerald (Gunsmith) pulled it together in a timely manner installing a P365 Safety Conversion Kit on my weapon. The work was done in minimal time resulting in me feeling much safer with 12+1 configuration. Customer service was without par, quality of the work was perfect and the pricing was very competitive. Wishing you guys the best in biz. Stay safe, be alert. Best. CMF sends...

name: Chris Knight
text:
I stopped in today to test fire a new mossberg 88 I picked up. Had a hard time finding ammo before I arrived, but they happened to have a couple boxes of ammo i could use.

The staff is friendly, courteous, and very informative. They take the time to explain what it takes to fire at the range with ease, and have a cushy waiting area to view a quick training video. The whole process was smooth and easy.

The range safety officers are well on their game. I felt safe the entire time on the range, and they were able to quickly explain the touch screen track interface, and further explaining that safety is a top priority.

I signed on for 30 minutes, and decided to fire my .40 before testing the shotgun. The touch screen interface has me sold on coming back to bullet and barrel. With just a click, the target goes the exact distance. Takes all the guesswork out of the experience.

I fired my pistol, and was pleased with the range itself. The design is new and clean. And with the RSOs keeping an eye on everything, it's a great environment to enjoy your firearms.

I tried the 88, and it performed beautifully. I added some extra cushion due to a shoulder injury. For those that would ask, you can't shoot bird shot here. But you can fire buck shot and slugs. But I'll tell you, it's fun firing a shotgun at this range.

Afterward I wandered around and struck up conversations with some of the staff, and showed me a selection for sale. I was impressed with the inventory, as well as pricing. I see myself buying my next firearm from here.

For me, it's a bit of a drive from Madison. But good business is where you find it, and Bullet and Barrel is my newest one stop shop for all things firearms. Plus, open on Sunday!

Dont take my word for it, stop in and check them out today! I'll be back soon, keep up the good work guys.

resp.text: Thank you for coming down! Please come back soon and....May the force be with you ;)

name: Karen Smith
text: State of the art range! The employees are always friendly and helpful - from the sales team to the RSOs! Everyone is very professional and committed to ensuring the safety of everyone who walks through the doors. I would absolutely recommend this place to any of my friends or family without hesitation!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Please come back soon!

name: JonPaul Wise
text: I recently moved to Huntsville and wanted to find a new class 3 place to call my "local shop". This place is a perfect example of how to do things right, treated me like I was a long time customer right from the start and after just a few visits I feel like I've been coming here for years. Very veteran friendly and the facility is far beyond just a gun shop. I've lived in 8 cities over 5 states in the past 10 years and this place is on the top without a doubt!

name: Justin W (JdogAwesome)
text: Extremely well maintained and high quality range! The firearm rentals where great and the guns where in pristine condition! The range officers where super nice and helped us a ton as it was my first time using a pistol. Can't recommend this place enough!

name: Adrian Farrales
text: Bullet and Barrel is a great place! They have a wide selection of firearms and a very nice indoor range, but what I like most about this place is that they offer excellent classes relating to firearms. Jeff is one of the staff members there and he is a great teacher. The folks working at Bullet and Barrel are experts and they'll make sure you get everything right. If you're looking for instructional classes on anything related to firearms, then Bullet and Barrel is definitely the place!

name: Lynn Watts
text: Took the handgun cleaning class with Jeff.  It was very informative.  I learned how to disassemble, clean and reassemble a firearm.  The tip about the grease was especially good since I have trouble at times with pulling the slide.  Thanks for the exceptional training.

name: David Norg
text:
Needed my scope mounted on a new rifle.
Made the mistake of taking it to another popular local business to get it done. Clearly was not a professional installation.
Gerald with Bullet and Barrel reinstalled the scope and rings on the spot and did it right!
Great people and service!

name: Carrie Givens
text:
I just made the best investment today, my new Wilson combat edcx9l firearm and I love It. Jeff was extremely helpful and the experience was awesome. I just started taking classes, and Jeff made sure I knew everything that I needed to know about the firearm before I left. He was very patient, considerate, and knowledgeable. Thank you Jeff, you’re awesome!
- C T Davis

name: Marquiz Liner
text: Can’t recommend Bullet and Barrel enough! The staff is very knowledgeable and extremely helpful! The range is clean, well-maintained, and well-managed by the excellent RSOs. Everyone we’ve encountered has been super nice! If you’ve never been, I highly recommend you check them out! They’re awesome!

name: Telia Norg
text: Just had a scope remounted correctly.  Took to another gun shop and they apparently had no idea what they were doing. As soon as we showed the clerk the firearm he immediately knew what was wrong. This is our place from now on.  Thanks

name: Hilary Crimmins
text:
Nice clean and well ventilated facility.
But honestly it is overpriced, and has extremely long waits. Members get preference and can be observed jumping the line before non-members for range access. I've even had a staff member tell me that they only had 4 boxes of ammo left and would only sell to members.
Today we, two of us for one lane, arrived at 2:15pm and paid for 30 minutes on the range. We waited well over 2 hours and did not get our full 30 minutes because they were closing. It's not worth it.

resp.text: We totally understand the frustration. We were extremely busy today as I'm sure you saw! With everything going on in the firearm industry we are trying to do everything we can. But we do have members who pay a monthly fee and part of that benefit is jumping the line. Kind of like Disney! We would love for you to give us another opportunity. Please reach out to me, Louis, at 256-384-4867 and we will make sure you have a 5 star experience

name: Joyce Maxwell
text: Had a wonderful experience Saturday with my daughter's. Took a class with Tommy, can't say enough about his wonderful teaching skills. We were nervous but with Tommy's great personality it wasn't long till we were calm and enjoying ourselves. Thank you so very much. We'll definitely be back!!

name: Andrew Emmerton
text: I took a private lesson with Jeff and he was very knowledgeable, I highly recommend taking a lesson. The rest of the staff were also great and they have a great selection of firearms for sale as well as some to rent for their indoor range.

name: Chad Jones
text: Louis and the crew at bullet and Barrel are first rate and so is their facility.  I've had some minor gunsmithing done as well, mainly to check suppressor alignment and get a few breaks lockset on, service has been fast and very affordable.  I've had a few problematic firearms inspected as well and John, their gunsmith, has always been straight forward and accurate.  Of the range facilities in the area, BnB stands head and shoulders above the rest.  I have range passes to go to other ranges for free, but I would rather spend some money at BnB to be with a better crowd and make sure their level of commitment to the average gun owner is rewarded.  When it comes to stores that are in your corner as a gun owner, these guys are bar none best of the best in our area.

name: pauline bracken
text: Sarah did a fantastic job teaching me how to firearm! I actually would give her 10 ⭐️ Since I haven’t in years!! I probably will take another class before I actually buy a pistol! Thank you again for your patience and spending over 2 hours with me! I had a wonderful time!!

text: Sarah was a wonderful instructor!  Her patience went above and beyond what I would have expected from an instructor, and her knowledge is tremendous.  In addition, she is continuing to work with me to help me figure out the best firearm for personal use.

text:
I went because I was having the hardest time removing the retaining pin from the firing pin of my Remington 870. So I took the bolt down to Bullet and Barrel. The gunsmith was able to remove the pin and lathe down a manufacturing defect in it that was keeping it in the bolt.
I was very satisfied and impressed with Bullet and Barrel and will definitely return for the many other services they offer.
